variables.name: md-content-jump-left-active
variables.description:
The left position of the content jump link when it has gained keyboard focus. This is
for the link that appears in the navigation drawer that skips to the main content.

variables.name: md-enable-ios-scroll-momentum
variables.description:
Boolean if iOS should allow scroll momentum in places where manual scrolling
is enabled.

variables.name: md-content-jump-left-inactive
variables.description:
The left position of the content jump link when it does not have keyboard focus. This is
for the link that appears in the navigation drawer that skips to the main content.

variables.name: md-content-jump-top-active
variables.description:
The top position of the content jump link when it has gained keyboard focus. This is
for the link that appears in the navigation drawer that skips to the main content.

variables.name: md-content-jump-top-inactive
variables.description:
The top position of the content jump link when it does not have keyboard focus. This is
for the link that appears in the navigation drawer that skips to the main content.

mixins.name: react-md-accessibility
mixins.description:
Creates the _accessible_ styles and class names.

This will create the following class names:
- `.md-fake-btn`
- `.md-no-scroll`
- `.md-pointer--hover`
- `.md-pointer--none`
- `.md-content-jump`

mixins.name: md-ios-scroll-momentum
mixins.description:
A simple mixin that will add scroll momentum to a class ONLY if the momentum is
enabled via the mixin or the `$md-enable-ios-scroll-momentum` variable.

parameters.name: enable-momentum
parameters.description:
Boolean if the momentum
    should be added

variables.name: md-inline-autocomplete

variables.name: md-autocomplete-suggestion-top
variables.description: The position from the top of the text field that the inline autocomplete suggestion should appear.

variables.name: md-autocomplete-suggestion-mobile-floating-top

The position from the top of the text field with a floating label that the inline autocomplete suggestion
should appear on mobile devices.

variables.name: md-autocomplete-suggestion-mobile-block-top
variables.description:
The position from the top of a blocked text field that the inline autocomplete suggestion should appear on
mobile devices.

variables.name: md-autocomplete-suggestion-desktop-floating-top

The position from the top of the text field with a floating label that the inline autocomplete suggestion
should appear.

variables.name: md-autocomplete-suggestion-desktop-block-top
variables.description:
The position from the top of a blocked text field that the inline autocomplete suggestion should appear on
desktop screens.

mixins.name: react-md-autocompletes

Includes any additional styles for autocompletes if `include-inline` is `true`.
The `Autocomplete` component really depends on all the styles for text fields and menus.

This will end up creating the `.md-autocomplete-suggestion` class name that is used
for the inline suggestions for autocompletes.

variables.name: md-portrait-media
variables.description:
The media query to detect devices in portrait mode. Normally you could just do something
like `(orientation: portrait)`, but this doesn't work when the soft keyboard appears. The
only part of the specification for portrait is that the "height" is greater than the "width"
of the device. Android devices reduce the screen height when the soft keyboard appears and
it is now considered landscape with this logic.

variables.name: md-landscape-media
variables.description: The media query to detect devices in landscape mode.

variables.name: md-mobile-media
variables.description: The default mobile media query.

variables.description: The default media query for a landscape mobile device.

variables.description: The default media query for a tablet device.

variables.description: The default media query for a portrait tablet device.

variables.name: md-tablet-landscape-media
variables.description: The default media query for a landscape tablet device.

variables.name: md-desktop-media
variables.description: The default media query for a desktop device.

variables.name: md-media-included
variables.description:
Boolean if the media queries should be included by default for all component mixins.
Set this to false if you want to manually include them. It is really only beneficial
if you want to join all media queries into one, but you can always use a postcss plugin
to combine them if you are worried about bundle size.

mixins.name: react-md-tabs-mobile-portrait
mixins.description:
Includes the styles for tabs on mobile devices that are portrait.
This really only adds styles for offsetting the tabs content when there is
a toolbar. No styles will be included if the `$include-toolbars` or `$include-swipeable`
params are `false`.

This mixin will define some offset class names to position the tabs content.
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-icon`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-prominent`

parameters.name: include-icons
parameters.description:
Boolean if the styles for offsetting the
    tabs content when there is a tab with both a label and an icon.

parameters.name: include-toolbars
parameters.description:
Boolean if the styles for offsetting
    the tabs content when there is a `.md-tabs-container` containing both a toolbar and tabs.

parameters.name: include-prominent-toolbars
parameters.description:
Boolean if the styles
  for offsetting the tabs content when there is a `.md-tabs-container` containing both a prominent toolbar
  and tabs.

parameters.name: include-swipeable
parameters.description: Boolean if the tab's content is swipeable.

- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`

mixins.name: react-md-everything
mixins.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-everything
mixins.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base CSS the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if using the light theme.

parameters.name: html-class-name
parameters.description:
The html className to nest every component
    in. This should really be used if switching from the light or dark theme.

parameters.name: error-color
parameters.description: The error color to use.

parameters.name: progress-swatch
parameters.description:
The color for the linear progress
    swatch color.

parameters.name: primary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the primary color.

parameters.name: primary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--primary` class name.

parameters.name: secondary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the secondary color.

parameters.name: secondary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--secondary` class name.

parameters.name: data-table-contextual-fallback-color
parameters.description:
An optional fallback
    color for the data table's contextual header when the `$primary-color` is not material design color.

parameters.name: linear-progress-fallback-color

An optional fallback color for
    the linear progress when the `$secondary-color` is not a material design color.

parameters.name: switch-ball-fallback-color
parameters.description:
An optional color to use for the switch's ball thumb
    when the `$secondary-color` is not a material design color.

you want to update the navigation drawer's color when a new tab is clicked.

examples.code: this.setState({ themeTabActive: activeTabIndex === 1 })} />

mixins.name: react-md-colors
mixins.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-text--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-text--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-text--error - Styles the `color` to be the error text color.
- md-text--theme-primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-text--theme-secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-text--theme-primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-text--theme-secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description: Boolean if the media queries should also be included.

parameters.name: include-color-class-names
parameters.description:
Boolean if a class name
    should be created for every color as well.

The opacity to apply to the primary color with the `md-background--primary`
    class name.

parameters.description:
The text color for any text

The opacity to apply to the secondary color with the `md-background--secondary`

The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--secondary` class name.

parameters.name: error-color
parameters.description: The text color for any text that appears in the `md-text--error` class name.

mixins.name: react-md-everything
mixins.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-everything
mixins.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base CSS the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if using the light theme.

parameters.name: html-class-name
parameters.description:
The html className to nest every component
    in. This should really be used if switching from the light or dark theme.

parameters.name: error-color
parameters.description: The error color to use.

parameters.name: progress-swatch
parameters.description:
The color for the linear progress
    swatch color.

parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the primary color.

The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--primary` class name.

parameters.name: secondary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the secondary color.

parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--secondary` class name.

Some Content

Themes the buttons ONLY when the `$primary-color` does not equal the `$md-primary-color`,
the `$secondary-color` does not equal the `$md-secondary-color`, or the `$md-light-theme`
does not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description:
The primary color to theme the
    buttons with.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description:
The secondary color to theme
    the buttons with.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if the buttons should be styled
    for the light theme.

parameters.name: include-flat
parameters.description:
Boolean if the flat styles for
    buttons should be included.

parameters.name: include-raised
parameters.description:
Boolean if the raised styles for
    buttons should be included.

parameters.name: include-icon
parameters.description:
Boolean if the icon styles for
    buttons should be included.

parameters.name: include-floating
parameters.description:
Boolean if the floating styles for
    buttons should be included.

variables.name: md-card-include-text
variables.description: Boolean if the styles for the `CardText` component should be included by default.

variables.name: md-card-include-title
variables.description: Boolean if the styles for the `CardTitle` component should be included by default.

variables.name: md-card-include-title-avatar
variables.description:
Boolean if the styles for having an icon in the `CardTitle` component should be included
by default. IF this is set, the `$md-card-include-title` will automatically be true.

variables.name: md-card-include-actions
variables.description: A boolean if the styles for the `CardActions` component should be included by default.

variables.name: md-card-include-tables
variables.description: Boolean if the styles for tables within cards should be included.

variables.name: md-card-padding-extra
variables.description:
When the card part is either the first or last in the card, this padding will be applied
instead of the `$md-default-padding`.

variables.name: md-card-text-font-size
variables.description: The font size for the CardText component.

variables.name: md-card-title-font-size
variables.description: The card title's font size.

variables.name: md-card-title-large-font-size
variables.description: The card title's larger font size.

mixins.name: react-md-cards
mixins.description:
Includes the styles for cards. The different sections can be excluded by setting the parameter
to false. If the `react-md-everything` mixin is being used, set the corresponding variables to
false before including the mixin.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description:
Boolean if the media queries should
    also be included.

parameters.name: include-text
parameters.description:
Boolean if the `CardText` component styles
    should be included.

parameters.name: include-title
parameters.description:
Boolean if the `CardTitle` component
    styles should be included.

parameters.name: include-title-avatar
parameters.description:
Boolean if the styles for
    an avatar in the `CardTitle` component should also be included. If this is `true`, and the
    `include-title` param is false, it will behave as if the `include-title` was also set to `true`.

parameters.name: include-actions
parameters.description:
Boolean if the `CardActions` component
    styles should be included.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-text
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the `CardText` component only.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-title
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the `CardTitle` component only.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-title-avatar
mixins.description:
Includes the styles for an avatar in the `CardTitle` component only.

This really requires the styles of avatars to already be included.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-actions
mixins.description:
Includes the styles for the `CardActions` component only.

This really depends on the styles of dialog footers to already be included.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-tables
mixins.description:
Creates the styles for tables in cards. This should _normally_ be included
with the `react-md-cards` mixin.

placeholders.name: md-table-column--plain
placeholders.description:
A selector for creating a plain styled column. This is used to update all
the `md-table-column--data` in a `.md-data-table--plain` and to create a
`md-table-column--plain` class. The `white-space` will still need to manually
be changed from `nowrap` to `initial` if you want line wrapping.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-plain
variables.description: Boolean if the plain table styles should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-checkboxes
variables.description: Boolean if the checkbox styles should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-edit-dialog
variables.description: Boolean if the edit dialog styles should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-select-fields
variables.description: Boolean if the styles for select fields in data tables should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-fixed-headers-footers
variables.description: Boolean if the styles for fixed table headers/footers should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-pagination
variables.description: Boolean if the table pagination styles should be included.

variables.name: md-data-table-selected-over-hover
variables.description:
Boolean if the selected state of the data tables should have higher precedence over the hover state.
The default behavior is to allow the hover state to show up even if the row is selected. If this value
is enabled, the hover effect will not show up at all when a row is selected.

variables.name: md-data-table-fixed-include-headers
variables.description:
Boolean if the `react-md-make-fixed-table` mixin should include headers by default in the
created styles.

variables.name: md-data-table-fixed-include-footers
variables.description:
Boolean if the `react-md-make-fixed-table` mixin should include footers by default in the
created styles.

variables.name: md-data-table-fixed-use-view-height
variables.description:
Boolean if the `react-md-make-fixed-table` mixin should make the table fixed relative to the
view height instead of just using height.

variables.name: md-data-table-pagination-mobile-shrinking
variables.description:
Boolean if the `TablePagination`'s styles should be updated for mobiles devices
so that the select field shrinks its font size to 13px;

This should normally be used along with the `md-data-table-pagination-mobile-label-hidden`
variable if you want to support mobile devices.

variables.name: md-data-table-pagination-mobile-label-hidden
variables.description: This will hide the `TablePagination`s label on mobile devices.

variables.name: md-data-table-include-table-card-headers
variables.description: Boolean if the table card header styles should be included.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-min-width
variables.description: The min width for an edit dialog's column.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-width
variables.description: The width for the edit dialog.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-label-width
variables.description:
The width for the label for the edit dialog column. When this width
is reached, the text will be ellipsed.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-label-padding
variables.description:
The amount of padding to apply to the `AccessibleFakeButton` that gets used in the
edit dialog column to trigger the dialog to appear.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-padding
variables.description: The amount of padding to provide to the edit dialog.

variables.name: md-edit-dialog-padding-bottom
variables.description:
The amount of padding-bottom to provide to the edit dialog. If you set this value to
null, only the `$md-edit-dialog-padding` variable will be used.

variables.name: md-data-table-edit-dialog-mobile-right
variables.description:
For some reason, the edit dialogs on mobile devices don't position themselves like tablets
and desktop screens so this value is required for positioning the dialog from the right edge
of the screen.

variables.name: md-data-table-padding
variables.description: The default left/right padding for a `TableColumn`.

variables.name: md-data-table-min-padding
variables.description: The minimum distance between a cell's content and the next cell.

variables.name: md-data-table-content-font-size
variables.description: The font size for content inside of the `TableBody` component.

variables.name: md-data-table-header-font-size
variables.description: The font size for the content inside of the `TableHeader` component.

variables.name: md-data-table-header-height
variables.description: The height for the `TableHeader`'s row.

variables.name: md-data-table-header-icon-font-size
variables.description: The font size for a font-icon in the `md-table-column--header`.

variables.name: md-data-table-column-height
variables.description: The height for a column in a data table.

variables.name: md-data-table-plain-column-height
variables.description: The height for a plain data table's column.

variables.name: md-data-table-border-size
variables.description: The border size to use for each row.

variables.name: md-data-table-hover-color
variables.description: The hover color for a row when using the light theme.

variables.name: md-data-table-selected-color
variables.description: The selected color for a row when using the light theme.

variables.name: md-data-table-dark-theme-hover-color
variables.description:
The hover color for a row when using the dark theme. This is configurable since
the dark theme data table specs are not defined in the material design documentation
at this point.

variables.name: md-data-table-dark-theme-selected-color
variables.description:
The selected color for a row when using the dark theme. This is configurable since
the dark theme data table specs are not defined in the material design documentation
at this point.

variables.name: md-data-table-card-header-z-index
variables.description: The z-index to use for the contextual table card header.

variables.name: md-data-table-card-header-font-size
variables.description: The font size to use for the contextual table card header.

variables.name: md-data-table-card-header-height
variables.description: The height for the table card header.

variables.name: md-data-table-fixed-wrapper-min-width
variables.description: The min-width to apply to the fixed tables wrapper.

variables.name: md-data-table-contextual-fallback-color
variables.description:
A fallback color to use for the contextual table card header. This is only required
when the `$md-primary-color` is not a valid material design color.

mixins.name: react-md-cards-tables
mixins.description:
Creates the styles for tables in cards. This should _normally_ be included
with the `react-md-cards` mixin.

mixins.name: react-md-data-tables
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the data tables.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description:
The secondary color to use to theme
    the table card headers with.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if the tables should be styled
    for the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description: Boolean if the media queries should also be included.

parameters.name: include-plain
parameters.description:
Boolean if the plain data
    table styles should be included.

parameters.name: include-checkboxes
parameters.description:
Boolean if the checkbox
    styles should be included.

parameters.name: include-edit-dialog
parameters.description:
Boolean if the edit
    dialog styles should be included.

parameters.name: include-pagination
parameters.description:
Boolean if the pagination
    styles should be included.

parameters.name: include-table-card-headers
parameters.description:
Boolean if
    the table card header styles should be included.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table
mixins.description:
Creates the styles for the data table. It will also create the styles for
plain data tables if the param is true.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-rows
mixins.description: Creates the styles for a row in the data table.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if styling for the light
    theme.

parameters.name: selected-over-hover
parameters.description:
Boolean if the selected state of
    rows should have a higher precedence than the hover state.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-column
mixins.description: Creates the styles for a column in a data table.

parameters.name: include-plain
parameters.description: boolean if the plain columns should be included

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-checkboxes
mixins.description: Creates the styles for a table checkbox column in a data table.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-edit-dialogs
mixins.description: Creates the styles for edit dialogs in a data table.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-select-fields
mixins.description: Creates the styles for select fields in data tables.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-paginations
mixins.description: Creates the styles for table pagination.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-fixed-headers-footers
mixins.description: Creates the styles for fixed headers and footers in a data table.

mixins.name: react-md-make-fixed-table
mixins.description:
This is a utility function for making a fixed table via CSS instead of inline styles. This one is a bit more
reliable since you can provide the cell heights correctly.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description:
The height to use for the fixed table. If this value is a boolean, the height
    will be calculated from the view height.

parameters.name: header-height
parameters.description:
The height for the table's header. If this is `null`,
    this table should *not* have a fixed header.

parameters.name: footer-height
parameters.description:
The height for the table's footer. If this is `null`,
    the table should *not* have a fixed footer.

parameters.name: toolbar-height
parameters.description:
An optional height of the toolbar to exclude when making the max-height of the
    table.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-card-headers
mixins.description:
Creates the styles for the `TableCardHeader` component only. The contextual
header will have a background color of the secondary color's 50 swatch.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description:
The secondary color to theme
    the contextual header's background color with.

mixins.name: react-md-data-table-paginations-shrink
mixins.description:
A mixin that can shrink the select field in the TablePagination component as well as hide the label
so it displays better on mobile devices. This mixin should usually be used in a media query that uses
the max-width.

parameters.name: shrink
parameters.description:
Boolean if the select field should shrink by
    reducing the font size to 13px and reducing the padding by 75%.

parameters.name: hide-label
parameters.description:
Boolean if the pagination label (Rows per page)
    should be hidden.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-data-tables
mixins.description:
Updates the styles for data tables only if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme`. The only styles really updated are the border colors and the
hover/selected row background colors.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to theme with.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if updating the styles for
    the light theme.

parameters.name: include-table-card-headers
parameters.description:
Boolean if
    the contextual table card header styles should be included.

parameters.name: contextual-fallback-color
parameters.description:
A fallback color
    to use for the contextual headers.

parameters.name: selected-over-hover
parameters.description:
Boolean if the selected state of
    rows should have a higher precedence than the hover state.

variables.name: md-chip-dark-theme-color

variables.name: md-chip-dark-theme-bg-color
variables.description:
The dark theme background color of a chip. This is configurable because it is not actually
specified in the docs.

variables.name: md-chip-height
variables.description: The height for a chip.

variables.name: md-chip-font-size
variables.description: The font size for a chip.

variables.name: md-chip-icon-color
variables.description: The remove icon color for a chip.

variables.name: md-chip-default-padding
variables.description:
The default padding to apply to a chip.
type Number

variables.description: The amount of padding to use around the remove icon on a chip.

variables.name: md-chip-icon-dense-padding

variables.name: md-chip-contact-font-size

mixins.name: react-md-chips
mixins.description:
Includes the styles for chips. The remove, avatar, and contact styles can be excluded.
If the `$include-contact` param is true, the avatar styles will always be included even
if `$include-avatar` is false.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if the chips should be themed for
    the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description:
Boolean if the media queries for chips
    should be included. This really relies on the `include-dense-icons` as well.

parameters.name: include-remove
parameters.description:
Boolean if the remove styles
    should be included.

parameters.name: include-avatar
parameters.description:
Boolean if the avatar styles
    should be included.

parameters.name: include-contact
parameters.description:
Boolean if the contact styles
    should be included.

parameters.name: include-dense-icons
parameters.description:
Boolean if the dense spec for
    icons should be included with the remove icon.

mixins.name: react-md-chips-avatar
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the avatars in chips.

mixins.name: react-md-chips-remove
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the remove icons in chips.

mixins.name: react-md-chips-contact
mixins.description: Includes the styles for the contact chips.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-chips
mixins.description:
Updates the styles for chips based on the theme. If the `light-theme` equals the `md-light-theme`,
no styles will be included.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if styling for the light theme.

variables.description:
This is a map of all the material design base colors so that you can programmatically get
variables with the neat sass-map functions.

variables.name: md-light-theme-colors
variables.code:
$md-light-theme-colors: (
  text: $md-light-theme-text-color,
  secondary: $md-light-theme-secondary-text-color,
  icon: $md-light-theme-icon-text-color,
  disabled: $md-light-theme-disabled-text-color,
  hint: $md-light-theme-hint-text-color,
  divider: $md-light-theme-divider-color,
  background: $md-light-theme-background-color,
  card: $md-light-theme-card-color,
  hover: $md-light-theme-divider-color,
  toolbar: $md-light-theme-app-bar-color,
);
variables.description: A mapping of all the light-theme colors.

variables.name: md-dark-theme-colors
variables.code:
$md-dark-theme-colors: (
  text: $md-dark-theme-text-color,
  secondary: $md-dark-theme-secondary-text-color,
  icon: $md-dark-theme-icon-text-color,
  disabled: $md-dark-theme-disabled-text-color,
  hint: $md-dark-theme-hint-text-color,
  divider: $md-dark-theme-divider-color,
  background: $md-dark-theme-background-color,
  card: $md-dark-theme-card-color,
  hover: rgba($md-black-base, .12),
  toolbar: $md-dark-theme-app-bar-color,
);

variables.name: md-colors-warn-md
variables.description:
Boolean if the there should be warnings about colors not being from material design. This
is enabled by default to alert users of the lib to set the correct fallback colors.

functions.name: get-color
functions.description: A utility function for getting a color from either the light or dark theme.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The color name to look up.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if it is for the light theme.

returns.description:
the color for the theme or null if it is not a color that changes
    based on the theme.

functions.name: get-swatch
functions.description:
A utility function to take a color and get a different swatch/accent color
in the same family.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The material design color to get a swatch for.

parameters.name: swatch
parameters.description: The swatch to get.

parameters.name: accent
parameters.description: Boolean if the swatch is the accent color.

parameters.name: fallback-color
parameters.description:
An optional color to fallback if the given color
    is not a valid material design color.

parameters.name: fallback-name
parameters.description:
An optional name for the fallback color's variable
    to help set a correct fallback value.

returns.description: the color with the correct swatch.

mixins.name: react-md-colors-hover
mixins.description:
Creates the two class names for getting a primary or secondary background hover effect,
Since the `:hover` selector still gets applied on mobile devices, these styles are wrapped
in the desktop media query.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description:
The primary color to use as the base for the
    hover effect.

parameters.name: primary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the primary color.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description:
The secondary color to use as the base for the
    hover effect.

parameters.name: secondary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the secondary color.

mixins.name: react-md-color-class-names
mixins.description:
This will create two class names for every material design color. The first
class name can be used to style any text with that color, while the other will
be used to style the background color.

parameters.name: include-text
parameters.description: Boolean if the text class name should be created.

parameters.name: include-background
parameters.description: Boolean if the background class name should be created.

mixins.name: react-md-color-class-name
mixins.description:
Creates 0 - 2 class names for a given color. No classes will be created if both
`$include-text` and `$include-background` are false.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The class name prefix to use.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to apply to text, background, or both.

parameters.name: include-text
parameters.description: Boolean if the text class name should be created.

parameters.name: include-background
parameters.description: Boolean if the background class name should be created.

mixins.name: react-md-colors
mixins.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-text--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-text--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-text--error - Styles the `color` to be the error text color.
- md-text--theme-primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-text--theme-secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-text--theme-primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-text--theme-secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description: Boolean if the media queries should also be included.

parameters.name: include-color-class-names
parameters.description:
Boolean if a class name
    should be created for every color as well.

parameters.name: primary-opacity
parameters.description:
The opacity to apply to the primary color with the `md-background--primary`
    class name.

parameters.name: primary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--primary` class name.

parameters.name: secondary-opacity
parameters.description:
The opacity to apply to the secondary color with the `md-background--secondary`
    class name.

parameters.name: secondary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--secondary` class name.

parameters.name: error-color
parameters.description: The text color for any text that appears in the `md-text--error` class name.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-colors
mixins.description:
This will conditionally update theme colors. The theme colors will only
be updated if their value does not equal the global value.

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description:
Boolean if the media queries for the hover effects should
    also be included

parameters.name: primary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the primary color.

parameters.name: primary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--primary` class name.

parameters.name: secondary-opacity
parameters.description: The opacity to apply to the secondary color.

parameters.name: secondary-background-text-color
parameters.description:
The text color for any text
    that appears inside the `md-background--secondary` class name.

parameters.name: error-color
parameters.description: The text color for any text that appears in the `md-text--error` class name.

mixins.name: react-md-grid
mixins.description:
Creates the styles for grids in material design. This basically
creates a main flex container `.md-grid` that will style cells
with appropriate margins and widths.

The following classes will be created:
- `.md-grid` - The main flex container. You should use this along with the `.md-cell` to get
the correct gutter and margins for a material design page.
- `md-grid--stacked` - This will allow the grid to be column based instead of row based.
- `.md-grid--no-spacing` - An optional class name to use with the `.md-grid`. When they are used
together, all the margins and spacings will be removed from the grid.
- `.md-cell` - The main container for a column or cell in the grid. If this is used alone, the default
behavior is to display 1 cell per row on mobile devices, 2 cells per row on tablets, and 3 cells per row
on desktop / larger screens. For more fine tuning, it can be used along with one of the following.
- `.md-cell--right` - This simply applies `margin-left: auto` to a cell. This is basically the same as applying
`float: right` in a row.
- `.md-cell--top` - This aligns the cell to the top of a row.
- `.md-cell--middle` - This aligns the cell to the middle of a row vertically.
- `.md-cell--center` - This aligns the cell to the center of a row horizontally.
- `.md-cell--bottom` - This aligns the cell to the bottom of a row.
- `.md-cell--stretch` - This aligns the cell to stretch the entire height of a row. This is the default behavior.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER` - This is will allow a cell to span this many columns on all media sizes. When the `NUMBER`
is greater than the number of columns allowed for a media device, it will span the entire row. This basically means
that if you are using the base configuration options and following the material design specs, mobile devices only
allow 4 columns per row, tablets 8 per row, and desktops 12. So specifying `.md-cell .md-cell--6` would span an
entire row on mobile devices, 3/4 of a row on tablets, and 1/2 of a row on desktops.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-offset` - This will offset the cell by the given number of columns. If the `number` is greater
than the maximum amount of columns allowed for the device's screen size, an entire row will be blank.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-phone` - This will set the cell's size only for mobile devices.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-tablet` - This will set the cell's size only for tablet devices.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-desktop` - This will set the cell's size only for desktop / large screens.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-phone-offset` - This will offset the cell's position only for mobile devices.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-tablet-offset` - This will offset the cell's position for tablet devices.
- `.md-cell--NUMBER-desktop-offset` - This will offset the cell's position for desktop / large screens.
- `.md-cell--phone-hidden` - This will hide a cell only for mobile devices.
- `.md-cell--tablet-hidden` - This will hide a cell only for tablet devices.
- `.md-cell--desktop-hidden` - This will hide a cell only for desktop / large screens.
- `.md-cell--order-NUMBER` - This is an optional class name you can apply if you want this item to appear in a different
order on the grid.
- `.md-cell--order-NUMBER-phone` - This will set the cell's order only for mobile devices.
- `.md-cell--order-NUMBER-tablet` - This will set the cell's order only for tablet devices.
- `.md-cell--order-NUMBER-desktop` - This will set the cell's order only for desktop / large screens.

take precedence over the mobile and desktop values so the margin is applied on all devices instead of based
on media queries.

variables.name: md-list-addon-line-height
variables.description:

This is really only applied if the line-height is altered in a parent element.

variables.name: md-navigation-drawer-enforce-height
variables.description:
Boolean if the navigation drawer's content should use the `height` attribute instead of
the `max-height`. When this is true, only the content will be scrollable instead of the
entire window.

variables.name: md-navigation-drawer-use-view-height
variables.description:
Boolean if the `height`/`max-height` should use `vh` instead of `%`. It is recommended to set
this to `false` instead of using `vh` because of the different calculations on devices.

If this is disabled, it is recommended to also add the following styles:
```scss
html,
body,
#app, // the entry point for the react app
div[react-root] {
  height: 100%;
}
```
This will allow for better height calculations throughout the app and not relying on the buggy `vh`.

messages are all optional. These sections can be enabled or disabled by modifying the params
on this mixin or modifying the default values. If the `$include-media` param is true, the
mobile and desktop media queries will be included for all included parts of the text fields.

Also if the `$md-text-field-custom-sizes` map is defined, each custom size will be created.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-themed
variables.description:
Boolean if the themed toolbars should be included. A themed toolbar
just has a different background color based on the `$md-light-theme`.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-prominent
variables.description:
Boolean if the prominent styles should be included for toolbars. This
really just makes a toolbar with a bigger height.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-btn-text
variables.description:
Boolean if the very small styles for flat or raised buttons in toolbars
should be included.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-text-fields
variables.description: Boolean if the styling for text fields in toolbars should be included.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-autocompletes
variables.description:
Boolean if the styles for autocompletes in toolbars should be included.
This really just updates the autocomplete's menu to span the entire viewport
on mobile devices.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-select-fields
variables.description: Boolean if the select field styling in toolbars should be included.

variables.name: md-toolbar-include-relative-padding-class-names
variables.description:
Boolean if two additional class names should be included for positioning toolbar relatives with `padding` instead of `margin`.
Creates `.md-toolbar-relative--padded` and `md-toolbar-relative--prominent-padded`

> NOTE: If `$md-toolbar-relative-padding` is `true`, these classes will still not be created. In addition,
if `$md-toolbar-include-prominent` is `false`, the prominent class name will not be created.

variables.name: md-toolbar-relative-padding
variables.description:
Boolean if the `.md-toolbar-relative` and `.md-toolbar-relative--prominent` should use `padding` instead of `margin`
for positioning.

variables.name: md-toolbar-inset-margin
variables.description: The amount of margin for an inset toolbar.

variables.name: md-toolbar-prominent-title-font-size
variables.description:
The toolbar's prominent title font size. This will only be included if it does not equal the
`$md-title-font-size` variable.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-portrait-height
variables.description: The height of a toolbar on mobile portrait devices.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-landscape-height
variables.description: The height of a toolbar on mobile landscape devices.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-prominent-height
variables.description: The height of a prominent toolbar on mobile devices and any media above.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-btn-keyline
variables.description: The keyline to use for the main nav button in the toolbar for mobile devices.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-title-keyline
variables.description: The keyline to use for the main title in the toolbar for mobile devices.

variables.name: md-toolbar-mobile-select-field-margin
variables.description: The top and bottom padding to apply to select fields that appear in toolbars.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-height
variables.description: The height of a toolbar for tablets and desktop displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-prominent-height
variables.description: The prominent height for a toolbar on tablet displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-btn-keyline
variables.description: The keyline to use for the main nav button in toolbars on tablets and desktop displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-title-keyline
variables.description: The keyline to use for the main title in a toolbar for tablets and desktop displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-select-field-margin
variables.description: The top and bottom padding to apply to select fields that appear in toolbars.

variables.name: md-toolbar-tablet-landscape-select-field-margin
variables.description: The top and bottom padding to apply to select fields that appear in landscape toolbars.

variables.name: md-toolbar-desktop-height
variables.description: An optional height to apply to toolbars only on desktop displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-desktop-prominent-height
variables.description: An optional height to apply to prominent toolbars on desktop displays.

variables.name: md-toolbar-desktop-btn-keyline
variables.description:
An optional keyline to apply to the action buttons and main navigation in toolbars on desktop
displays. If this is `null`, it will inherit the keyline from tablets.

variables.name: md-toolbar-desktop-title-keyline
variables.description:
An optional keyline to apply to the toolbar's title on desktop displays. If this is `null`, it will
inherit the keyline from tablets.

variables.name: md-toolbar-desktop-select-field-margin
variables.description:
An optional margin to apply to select fields that appear in toolbars on desktop displays. If this is `null`,
it will inherit the margins from tablets.

variables.name: md-toolbar-height
variables.description:
A height to use for the toolbar on all screen sizes. This value will have precedence over the mobile/tablet/desktop
variables.

variables.name: md-toolbar-prominent-height
variables.description:
A height to use for prominent toolbars on all screen sizes. This value will have precedence over the mobile/tablet/desktop
variables.

variables.name: md-toolbar-title-keyline
variables.description:
A title keyline to use for toolbars on all screen sizes. This value will have precedence over the mobile/tablet/desktop
variables.

variables.name: md-toolbar-btn-keyline
variables.description:
The keyline to use for the main navigation and action buttons in the toolbar. This value will have precedence over the
mobile/tablet/desktop variables.

variables.name: md-toolbar-select-field-margin
variables.description: The margin to apply to the top and bottom of a select field that appears in a toolbar.

variables.name: md-toolbar-z-index
variables.description: The z-index for a `fixed` toolbar.

mixins.name: react-md-toolbar-relative
mixins.description:
This is a utility mixin for creating the relative class names for toolbars. This should normally just be used within the `react-md-toolbars`
mixin. It will optionally create the following class names:

- `md-toolbar-relative`
- `md-toolbar-relative--padding`
- `md-toolbar-relative--prominent`
- `md-toolbar-relative--prominent-padding`

The class names will only be created if the related height is not null.

placeholders.name: md-transition--sharp
placeholders.description:
A placeholder for getting the sharp transition. The transition function for objects
that may return to the screen at any time.

placeholders.name: md-transition--standard
placeholders.description:
A placeholder for getting the standard (and default) transition. The transition function
for growing and shrinking material, among other property changes.

placeholders.name: md-transition--acceleration
placeholders.description:
A placeholder for getting the acceleration transition. The transition function for objects
that enter the screen at full velocity from off-screen and slowly decelerate to a resting point.

placeholders.name: md-transition--decceleration
placeholders.description:
A placeholder for getting the deceleration transition. The transition function for objects that
leave the screen at full velocity.

variables.name: md-transition-time
variables.description: The default transition time to use on most animations/transitions.

variables.name: md-transition-sharp
variables.description: The transition function for objects that may return to the screen at any time.

variables.name: md-transition-standard
variables.description:
The transition function for growing and shrinking material, among other property changes. This
is the most common and applied to every element by default.

variables.name: md-transition-acceleration

variables.name: md-html-min-width
variables.description:
The min width to apply to the `html` tag. This is set mostly if you are using
components that rely on hiding the main window's toolbar to prevent scrolling.

Setting this value to `null` will not update the `html` with the min-width.

mixins.name: react-md-typography
mixins.description:
This includes the CSS for simple typography in react-md. It will
update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font
family, set the line-height, text-rendering, and create the base
class names for the typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` is true,
the `h1` - `h6`, `p`, and `caption` tags will be updated with the
corresponding CSS class name.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description:
Boolean if the application
    is using the light theme.

parameters.name: include-media
parameters.description:
Boolean if the media queries
    should be included.

parameters.name: extend-html-tags
parameters.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should
    be updated or not.

parameters.name: include-text-container
parameters.description:
Boolean if the
    text container class name should be included.

parameters.name: include-utilities
parameters.description:
Boolean if the
    text helper class names should be included.

mixins.name: react-md-typography-text-container
mixins.description:
Creates a utility class name for containing long amounts of text. This is set up
to center the text in the page and keep the line width to the `$md-typography-max-line-length`.

mixins.name: react-md-typography-utilities
mixins.description: Creates utility class names for common text positioning and transforms.

mixins.name: host-google-font
mixins.description: Creates a font face for a locally hosted google font

parameters.name: font-name
parameters.description: The font name to create a font face for

parameters.name: font-weight
parameters.description: The font weight of the google font

parameters.name: fonts-url
parameters.description: The url to your fonts.

mixins.name: host-material-icons
mixins.description:
Hosts the material icon font library locally by declaring the font face
and the .material-icons CSS class.

parameters.name: font-url
parameters.description: The path to the material icons fonts

mixins.name: react-md-typography-mobile
mixins.description:
Creates the CSS for typography on mobile devices. If the `$extend-html-tags` param is true,
the `h6`, `h5`, `h4`, and `p` tags will also be modified. This should most likely be used within
a media query.

parameters.name: extend-html-tags
parameters.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should
    be updated.

mixins.name: react-md-typography-desktop
mixins.description:
Creates the CSS for typography on desktop screens. If the `$extend-html-tags` param is true,
the `h6`, `h5`, `h4`, and `p` tags will also be modified. This should most likely be used within
a media query.

parameters.name: extend-html-tags
parameters.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should
    be updated.

mixins.name: react-md-typography-media
mixins.description:
Includes the mobile and desktop media queries for typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` param is true,
the `h6`, `h5`, `h4`, and `p` tags will also be modified.

parameters.name: extend-html-tags
parameters.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should
    be updated.

mixins.name: react-md-theme-typography
mixins.description:
Updates the theme of the typography ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal `$md-light-theme`.
You will need to apply this `$html-class-name` to the `html` tag to get the effects. This is because
the base `html` tag had the background color set which everything inherits.

parameters.name: html-class-name
parameters.description: The class name to use for the html tag.

parameters.name: light-theme
parameters.description: Boolean if using the light theme.

parameters.name: extend-html-tags
parameters.description:
Boolean if the base html tags should be
    styled as well.
